intro: Acinodendron meridense, commonly known as the Canary Island acacia, is a shrub or small tree native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant has a woody stem with a rough, fissured bark, and its leaves are typically pinnate with small, oval leaflets. It is adapted to arid and rocky environments, showing resilience to drought and poor soil conditions. Acinodendron meridense plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
